channel.title: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college
channel.description:
As the title says, Portal has reached new curricular heights. [quote] College students across the country are returning to coursework, friends, and parental freedom soon, but the freshmen class at an Indiana college will find an all-new type of curriculum awaiting them.
According to a Mashable report, Valve's award-winning puzzle game Portal will appear alongside The Epic of Gilgamesh, Hamlet, and other required materials for incoming freshmen at Wabash College.
The game will be part of the college's "Enduring Questions" freshman seminar, which explores "fundamental questions of humanity" through "classical and contemporary works."
Michael Abbot, a theater professor at the school, is helping to design the course. Abbot was reportedly inspired to include Portal in the course's required experience material by a game theory article that drew similarities between the game and Erving Goffman's 1959 sociology text The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life.
According to the report, Abbot showed Portal to "non-gaming colleagues" and was pleased to learn that they approved of his plan to include both Goffman's work and Valve's game in the course's curriculum. During the course, students will read Goffman's text followed by a "collective playthrough" of Portal.
While experiencing Portal will not be part of every Enduring Questions section, it is currently being tested by Abbot and his colleagues in select courses.
Further, Abbot said he considered BioShock and Planescape Torment for the class but decided upon Portal because of its relative brevity. [/quote] [url]https://www.gamespot.com/news/6274450.html?om_act=convert&om_clk=hot-stories&tag=hot-stories;title;3[/url]
DISCUSS!

item.title: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college
item.dc:creator: Hakkuze
item.description:
I read this sitting in my college’s library. I wish I could use video games more often in college because some of them actually have a point, besides killing people and blowing crap up, although it is uncommon.

I can see discussions about what does GLaDOS mean when she says, “You will be baked and there will be cake?” Is she being literal, metaphoric, sarcastic? What does it mean to be human when you are not free, what does it mean to be free? On and on and on…It’d be ever so interesting to watch people fail at the puzzles too.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college

item.title: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Omega_Absolute:

Well they did say it was a “collective” playthrough, so I assume you would only need one person who would be willing to play while the others watched on the big screen.

Indeed… probably the professor playing on the projector making fun of the poor students who don’t get to do it

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
JeffMOD:

I’d like to do that course just for that requirement.
While my classmates are all still struggling with the concept of being able to go through both portals, I’ll be finishing up the boss battle. And then I will laugh. And laugh. And laugh.
Ha ha ho ho.

Read full topic

item.description:
k3nny1550:

Better- try reading “Beowulf.”

Most boring thing since “The Constant Gardener.”

Fuck you Beowulf is awsm.

item.source: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college

item.title: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Katana:

I’m a bit surprised; what if some class members don’t actually play video games? I actually personally know some people who simply could not even get used to moving around with WASD and the mouse. And heck; what if adults are in the class? (If you forget, some people actually decide to take college much later in life)

Well they did say it was a “collective” playthrough, so I assume you would only need one person who would be willing to play while the others watched on the big screen.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Deimos:

Poor bastards, i never want to play that game again.

I’ll probably play it a few more times in my lifetime, but I didn’t orgasm over it like the entirety of the internet did when it first came out. It’s an interesting story with very few puzzles that actually make you think and a decently fancy teleportation gimmick. Nowhere near the “greatness” of some old-ass boring poetry that has withstood the test of time. I doubt that in even 30 years Portal will be anything special.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college

item.title: Portal Game becomes a REQUIRED class at college
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Better than bloody English.

“Connect The Odyssey to The Kite Runner in a 6 paragraph essay” Why? God I hate that class.

I about committed suicide after the twentieth time I read about the young dawn’s rosy fingers. I KNOW ALREADY I GET IT USE ANOTHER ANALOGY :fffuuu:

Read full topic
